definition: ten-pin bowling/bowling ball/(baseball etc) ground ball
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!

sentences.english: She bowled the ball smoothly down the lane.
sentences.chinese: 她很顺当地把球投入地滚球场的球道。

sentences.english: You are not pitching right, Charlie Brown. How they are hitting the ball on the ground…
sentences.chinese: 你投的不正确，查理布朗，他们打出地滚球。

sentences.english: Hongkong Electric Lawn Bowls team players.
Former President of Penang Amatuer Swimming Association and Penang Lawn Bowl Association.
sentences.chinese: 曾担任槟州业余游泳公会和槟州草地滚球协会主席。

definition: to run up (pole vault, javelin, bowling etc)/approach/run-up/(aviation) takeoff run
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
